definition: to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to squash/to crush/to squeeze out of business/to drive out
to blow up (demolish with an explosion)

sentences.english: The new bridge over the railroad tracks eliminated danger in cros, sing.
sentences.chinese: 這座新垮越鐵軌的橋免除了越過鐵軌時的危險。

sentences.english: The last straw breaks the camels back.
sentences.chinese: 最後一根稻草能垮駱駝的背。

sentences.english: What if my entire business falls apart?
sentences.chinese: 如果整個生意都垮了呢？

sentences.english: If it fails, as occurred this year, market stability is undermined.
sentences.chinese: 如果這根支柱垮了，市場的穩定也就被破壞了。

sentences.english: The Orpheum Wiener House stayed afloat all through the Great Depression.
sentences.chinese: 從大蕭條開始到結束，俄爾甫香腸之家一直垮。

sentences.english: so then, yeah, I ended up coming out here just in time for everything to kind of crash
sentences.chinese: 我最終來到了這兒，正趕上一切都垮了的時候。

sentences.english: She didn't wear makeup, dressed in baggy, androgynous clothing, sang Western songs.
sentences.chinese: 化妝，穿鬆垮垮又雌雄同體的衣服，唱了西方歌。

sentences.english: Drink Kua body, dead in a battle.
sentences.chinese: 喝垮了身體，身死在一場戰陣中。

sentences.english: Earthquake destroyed our houses, but it cannot destroy our will.
sentences.chinese: 地震毀壞了我們的房屋，但震不垮我們的意志。

sentences.english: The French created a republic that collapsed a few years later.
sentences.chinese: 法國人建立的共和國幾年後就垮了臺。

sentences.english: The last time I saw her, she looked completely burnt herself out.
sentences.chinese: 我昀後一次看見她時，她看起來身體完全垮了。

sentences.english: The whole command structure had fallen.
Well, when the bough breaks, the cradle will fall.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，支幹斷掉時，搖籃就垮了。

sentences.english: If the euro collapses, Britain has the pound.
sentences.chinese: 如果歐元垮了，英國還有英鎊。

sentences.english: Five years later, I watched my mama's health decline.
sentences.chinese: 五年後，我看着我媽媽的健康垮了下去。

sentences.english: The chair gave out under the fat woman.
sentences.chinese: 這個胖女人把椅子坐垮了。

definition: to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to stand firm/to stand one's ground (in the face of adversity or pain)
